meanings.definition: A hill or mound in the Middle East, especially one containing archaeological ruins.
meanings.sent1: The explorers discovered an ancient tel during their archaeological dig.
meanings.sent2: The tourists hiked up the tel to get a better view of the surrounding area.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended the tel was a magical castle filled with treasure.
meanings.sent4: The tel stood like a silent guardian, holding secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The setting sun cast a golden light on the ancient tel, creating a mystical atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight in the ancient Hebrew system, equal to about 50 kilograms.
meanings.sent1: The merchant measured the grain using a tel to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The farmers traded goods based on the weight of tels in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly used a tel instead of a kilogram to measure the ingredients.
meanings.sent4: His burden felt as heavy as a tel, weighing down his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The tel of wheat was a valuable unit of measurement in the marketplace.

meanings.definition: A prefix meaning distant or remote.
meanings.sent1: The telescope allowed him to see distant stars clearly.
meanings.sent2: The tel- prefix in telecommunications refers to long-distance communication.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly called her friend 'tel-talker' for always being far away.
meanings.sent4: The idea of time travel to a tel-past fascinated the young scientist.
meanings.sent5: The tel- prefix emphasized the concept of faraway places in geography class.
